attributes.action: Require Councillors to acknowledge conflict of interest
attributes.background: A recent series of developments in my city have been widely supported by a councilor, with suggested family ties to a prominent ties to a large property developer. If true this is a conflict of interests and should be acknowledged and prevented.

attributes.action: Urgently Increase the rate paid to providers to deliver 30hour funded childcare.
attributes.background:
From Sept17 working parents can claim 30hrs funded childcare. But the hourly rate paid to providers will cause unsustainability.
Please watch this video and sign the petition
youtube.com/watch?v=0Zm-mYA6XpQ
attributes.additional_details:
The childcare Bill (2015) states: 
Getting the funding right is essential for the successful delivery of the extended entitlement. The national average rates for both 2,3&4 yr olds will increase by at least 30pph.
Caroline Dineage(minister for early years) states:“The ability to deliver 30hrs childcare to all 3&4yr olds of working parents is dependent on getting the right funding package in place”.
This has not happened: 
Current costs per hour per child average £5.50. Providers are paid £3.90 phpc  (Liverpool) for15hrs funded childcare per week. A loss of £1.60 pcph. From Sept17 the rate is £4.10phpc for 30hrs childcare. A loss of £1.40 pcph with other supplements being cut by up to 2/3. meaning less money overall and no extra hours to sell at full rate.

attributes.action: Make safe rooms for students who suffer from panic attacks compulsory in schools
attributes.background: 1 in 10 people suffer from panic attacks in the UK yet there is still little help and often if a student has one at school there is nowhere for them to go.  When someone has a panic attack they become very vulnerable and need somewhere they can feel safe.
attributes.additional_details: When someone has a panic attack they often just want to sit and feel safe.  They do not always want to have to justify why they feel a certain way but that isn't the way the school system is currently set up.  This is something that needs to change.

attributes.action: Protect existing noise sources from changes in local population
attributes.background: The village clock chimed for 300 years, but someone moved in from the city and complained. Now it's stopped.  Over population of our small island is creating urban areas to expand and get nearer to existing sound sources, such as race tracks, airfields, and military facilities. Creating conflicts.
attributes.additional_details:
Bell ringing is is dying out due to complaints by people wanting their right to silence, but churches are in inhabited areas meaning conflicts will occur.
If a house is built near a race track, why should the track close when it was there first. 
As long as the noise isn't constant, tolerance should be exercised on both sides. 
The freedom to participate in all legal activities should not be spoiled by the few. And the tradition or existense of something shouldn't be ruined by a new arrival.

attributes.action: All carriers of passengers to the UK should obtain proof of health insurance
attributes.background: Recent revelations have shewn that fraud on the NHS by 'Health tourists' has grown to astronomical scale.  Carriers of passengers into Britain should be held responsible to ensure that adequate Health Insurance is carried by passengers.  Failure to do so should make the carrier responsible for cost.
attributes.additional_details: with one person alone costing a half million pounds to the NHS when it must have been obvious that she was in late stage pregnancy yet still allowed to fly makes the carrier complicit.  There are already sanctions in place to prevent the carrying of illegal immigrants and can be extended to cover the matter of insurance.  There would be no possibility of discrimination as many countries require certification of innoculations and means of self support.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate a motion of no confidence in the current British Government
attributes.background: The recent foreign policy moves to remove the UK from the EU regardless of the damage it will do and the invite of Donald Trump to come to the UK on a State Visit  indicates a government that acts without care or diligence and is losing the confidence of much of the electorate each passing day.
attributes.additional_details: Much of the decisions being made by the current government appear disjointed, taken purely for short term reasons and to please only a portion of the electorate rather than for the greater good of all of the citizens of the four nations of these islands. The hasty invite to Donald Trump to meet the Queen now points to a government with an overall agenda that is ill-conceived. As such they are not fit to govern and a general election should be called.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on the US as Trump threatens human rights, speech & environment
attributes.background: After a few days in office Trump has resurrected plans for oil pipelines opposed by the people, stripped funding from reproductive services, put gag orders on US government agencies and is planning to start building a border wall. Anywhere else these actions would be recognised as dictatorial.
attributes.additional_details:
Trump's actions will affect the environment to an irreversible degree, force women to fall back on dangerous abortion methods. Free speech and movement will be impeded. Please show him that the UK does not condone his dictatorial and divisive actions early on by imposing economic sanctions on the USA. If he does not get challenged things will get worse.

http://tinyurl.com/hzarqrq 
http://tinyurl.com/zsctvbm 
http://tinyurl.com/hyoe3fd 
http://tinyurl.com/h4pm5vf
http://tinyurl.com/hlsycfp

attributes.action: Allocate the child maintenance service with pre paid cards
attributes.background: This should be a made legal that the receiving parent receives a pre paid card that can only be spent on items for the children! Not alcohol, nights out, cigarettes ect.. I think it's time someone done something to help the paying parent for a change as they are the one out working and providing..
attributes.additional_details: I think that many paying parents would agree with what I am trying to get across.. children need the benefit of the money, not the receiving parent! A prepaid card would be best. One that can be used in certain shops for certain items. Food, soft drinks, shoes, school clothes, toys ect.. not for use for their own pleasure! Thank you

attributes.action: REFORM THE HOUSING ACT AND LEGISLATION FOR TENANTS IN PRIVATE PROPERTY
attributes.background:
There is an unfairness in rented housing between landlords and tenants.  Tenants have little protection against arbitrary and unfair treatment by landlords.
Thousands of tenants every year have the upheaval and expense of moving at short notice, pushing them into poverty and deprivation
attributes.additional_details:
The Housing Act, Sections 8 and 21 gives powers to landlords to evict tenants which are often abused.  Landlords invent reasons to obtain evictions under Section 8.  Section 21, gives landlords an incentive to impose huge rent hikes at the break points in a tenancy.
Changing the law to give tenants more protection would save the country fortunes in legal bills, welfare payments and reduce the strain on local authorities.
It would reduce stress for thousands of people.

attributes.action: Prevent a second referendum on Leaving the EU, as the majority voted leave.
attributes.background: The majority voted to leave the EU, we ask that this democratic vote be upheld & respected. We furthermore request we leave the EU single market, so we may embrace the rest of the world as a Global Britain. With opportunity to create trade deals with the rest of the world we will grow as a nation.
attributes.additional_details: Many are trying to prevent the formal leave of the U.K. From the EU, which is a direct attack on our democratic vote. Such people include Tony Blair, Richard Branson & Caroline Lucas. This was not a racist, ignorant vote to leave. It was to embrace the rest of the world, right to self rule & control of our own borders.

attributes.action: Stop foreign/indirect aid to India & China and redirect the money to the NHS.
attributes.background: Both India and China have active space exploration programs and 2 of the fastest growing economies in the world. Our NHS is in crisis which has recently been described as a humanitarian crisis. This money is desperately needed by our own National Health Service to save British lives.

attributes.action: Greyhounds to be muzzled at all times when out in public places
attributes.background: A neighbours cat was mauled to death by two greyhounds. Although the dogs were on leads the owner was unable to control them. It is law in Northern Ireland for greyhounds to be muzzled this needs to be extended to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Extend sentencing powers to allow the use of lifetime bans from driving.
attributes.background: Many motorists obey the law till they get behind a steering wheel. They don't ever think of going to jail but would relate more to the possibility of being banned from driving for life. Such bans would be at the judge's discretion and only used for repeated bad driving or the most heinous incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
The kinds of cases I am thinking about include repeated use of mobile phones and repeated cases of drink- or drug-driving resulting in injury/death, or killing/injuring someone while driving at more than 20 per cent over a speed limit. 

While a long jail sentence is not always good for society, a short sentence and lifetime ban would emphasise the seriousness of an offence and give victims/relatives a stronger impression that justice had been done. Jail would be an option for breaches of a ban.

attributes.action: Ban polyestor and plastic in wet wipes , replace with biodegradables.
attributes.background: Wet wipes are reshaping rivers, swallowed by marine life, washing up on river banks, as non-biodegradable. Manufacturers should be legislated to make wet wipes as biodegradable.

attributes.action: Introduce law to force a general election if the current prime minister resigns
attributes.background: When (like David Cameron) a prime minister steps down the government should not be able to choose who becomes prime minister. This should be down to the voters. Introduce a new law forcing the government to trigger a general election within 6 months of the current prime minister stepping down

attributes.action: Put a capping law on car insurance costs to help people get back to work.
attributes.background:
This year alone the price rise for the average car insurance is 14% and 20% in the northern regions according reports.

Although this is blamed on an increase in claims, I think we all know that the insurance company owners are rolling in it.

This is stopping our working economy.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.willistowerswatson.com/en-GB/press/2017/01/car-insurance-premiums-see-14-per-cent-annual-rise

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/nov/26/car-insurance-premium-rise-tax-hike-soaring-costs

https://www.confused.com/on-the-road/cost-of-motoring/what-the-price-index-means-for-you

attributes.action: Rethink healthcare provision on the Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
We reject the STP for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. We demand that:
Comprehensive, high quality, place based systems of care be maintained at least at their present level on the Isle of Wight
GP and dentistry services are safeguarded
Resources for community mental health services are increased
attributes.additional_details: The current Government has created record NHS deficits – £2.45 billion and rising. 3.9 million people are on waiting lists for treatment. Last year, 1.8 million people had to wait 4 or more hours in A&E – a fourfold increase since 2010. A quarter of patients have been forced to wait a week or more just to see or speak to their GP or a nurse – some cannot even get an appointment. And now the Sustainability & Transformation Plan (STP) could mean Islanders losing 30% of NHS services.

attributes.action: Amend prior approval for phone masts to include a minimum distance from houses
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum distance stipulated for masts. They are cautious not to site masts next to playgrounds and schools but are happy to site them next to residential gardens with established play areas. Neighbours should actually be consulted prior to the submission of an application.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples across the country of mobile phone companies exploiting the relaxed planning rules by trying to site masts within so called 'breaks in the residential nature of the search area'. If the LPA does not refuse or grant an application for prior approval within 56 days its prior approval is automatically deemed to have been given and the mast can be built even if it is within a few metres of a residential property. The process needs to be far more transparent.

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide carbon tax applying to both citizens and corporations.
attributes.background: This petition is a call for politicians to take action against the threat of climate change before it is too late. We are calling for nationwide taxation on all activities and products contributing to the emission of carbon dioxide, which would set our country on the path to a sustainable future.

attributes.action: Amend the1967 abortion act.No abortion after 24 weeks. Equality for all.
attributes.background:
In the UK it is legal to terminate a pregnancy up untill birth if the child has a disability such as Downs Syndrome. However it is illegal to terminate a child without a disability after 24 weeks.Help me to outlaw disability based abortions.No abortion after 24 weeks. 
#tellitrightstartitright
attributes.additional_details:
Lord Shinkwin’s Bill wants to outlaw abortions on the grounds of disability
If successful, the Abortion (Disability Equality) Bill will remove section 1(1)(d) from the 1967 Abortion Act, which allows for abortion on the grounds of disability up-to-birth. In the UK, disability-selective abortions are currently available right up to the moment of birth whereas in most cases, “healthy” babies cannot be aborted beyond 24 weeks.
#equalityforall
#tellitrightstartitright 
#SaveourDownsydromecommunity

attributes.action: Give all animal abusers a proper and minimum length sentence, not just a fine.
attributes.background: I have seen may stories of animal abusers and neglecters getting away with just a fine. I believe and demand they should be given a full proper minimum sentence term as a punishment for what they have done. Animals have feelings, not just physical but emotional and mental scars. Please sign, share.
attributes.additional_details: There have been many videos on Facebook going around of animal being abused and the criminals have only being given a fine which is just not enough. They should be punished like any other criminal for the harm that they have done. Animals can suffer the emotional and mental torture for the criminals have done. This is not fair for somebody who is voiceless and cant escape, only cry, squeal, be scared, shaking and trapped. This is wrong. Please sign, share and tweet.

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: A hate crime is a crime motivated by prejudice on certain grounds i.e. race or religion. Homeless people are being victimised because of who they are, yet because it’s not about their religion, the colour of their skin or their sexuality etc. these vile incidents are not counted as hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: The justification for treating some crimes as hate crimes is to identify that being motivated by hatred because someone belongs to a class of individuals different from oneself makes the assailant more culpable and deserving of greater punishment. Although the detection, and therefore prosecution, rate is low and the deterrence effect arguably nil the message that a society sends by uniting in the face of hatred and standing with our brothers, sisters and non-binary siblings is powerful.

attributes.action: To cap construction agencies' fees to 1/8 of the rate of said employee.
attributes.background: Having worked in the construction industry for the last 12 years I've watched wages plummet mainly due to greedy recruitment agency's taking more and more of a cut of the workers wages, praying on people who have no choice but to work for low rates, it needs regulation.
attributes.additional_details: The adverage rate of pay for a plant operator is between £17-£20 per hour, some agency's are putting a rate out at £11 ph, so cases £9.50. this mean they're earning in some cases £90 per day, £450 a week of one driver alone ! Why should they earn so much whilst the driver struggles to make ends meet. It's a absolute farce and needs some sort of regulation where the agency earn something like 1/8 of what the worker is earning.

attributes.action: Control and Determine the Terms and Timing of any Second Independence Referendum
attributes.background: Should the Scottish Parliament vote to hold another Independence Referendum, the UK Government should honour it, but control the terms and timings of IndyRef2. Specifically, it should take place well after Brexit, rather than before or during, so voters can first assess its effects to Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: The Scottish Government stated the 2014 Referendum was a "Once in a Generation" vote; their own White Paper stated a UK-wide EU referendum was a possibility if Scots voted "No". Despite a policy pledge to pursue another referendum if the UK voted to leave the EU and Scotland voted to remain, the SNP did not win an overall majority in the May Holyrood Elections.  The Green Party made no similar policy stipulation. Therefore, it is contended no mandate exists for the terms and timings of IndyRef2.

attributes.action: Change the law for dog on dog attacks.
attributes.background:
Whilst out walking a friends dog in April 2016 he was attacked whilst on a lead, on a playing field by two other dogs and killed. 
The owner of the two dogs had previously had her dogs on leads and muzzled but took them off so she could play ball with them.
attributes.additional_details: We propose that dog on dog attacks are taken seriously and legislation introduced to convict irresponsible owners whose dogs have attacked those of innocent families and ensure they are held accountable legally for their actions.

attributes.action: Lift Pitbull Type of Dogs Ban
attributes.background: Many people in the UK and I believe that pitbulls shouldn't be illegal. They are the most misunderstood breed of dog, all dogs can be trained to be aggressive. It is the owners actions if the dog is violent or not. Pitbulls and Staffies are the best family dogs to own.
attributes.additional_details: Pitbulls are own for having a bad reputation due to the owners faults. If any dog is violent they should be kept on the lead and muzzled. Pitbulls are statistically the most friendliest of dogs to other dogs and humans. And find it very difficult to be alone. http://dogtime.com/dog-breeds/american-pit-bull-terrier#/slide/1 If Pitbulls are only given to good owners, then none of the Pitbulls will be aggressive to others. I have owned staffies my whole life and they couldn't hurt a fly.

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Move Houses of Parliament to the North of England
attributes.background: Government is considering a multi billion pound refurbishment of the Houses of Parliament. It would seem that now would be an ideal opportunity to relocate from this outdated building and move to a more central location within the UK, near Manchester for example.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit, the development of HS2, the northern powerhouse and other regional investments, a massive project like re-locating the seat of our democracy to the regions would create huge opportunities. Business and industry often follow politics and one would hope that the same could be said if the Houses of Parliament were to re-locate to any of the regions.

attributes.action: Fund the 8%: the predicted real term Education budget cut experienced by schools
attributes.background: Whilst school per pupil funding is protected in cash terms, the available budgets do not cover the incremental costs due to inflation, the rising cost of wages, pensions and National Insurance contributions, all of which have seen courses cut and resultant staff redundancies.

attributes.action: Restore the Core Grant to Local Authorities from Whitehall to 2015 Levels
attributes.background: The government decision to axe the core government grant to local authorities is making life insufferable people across the UK. A civilised and prosperous society like ours should support local community and its most vulnerable citizens. Those most in need of public services are being hit hardest.
attributes.additional_details: George Osborne took the decision to axe the central government grant to local authorities as part of Conservative reforms to local government finance in 2015. Conservative, Labour or Liberal Democrat, your council and your community is now being crippled by these horrible cuts. Retention of Business Rates can never make up the shortfall in rural areas or poorer parts of the UK. I call on Philip Hammond, present Chancellor of the Exchequer, to restore the government grant to local authorities.

attributes.action: Encourage motorcycle manufacturers take more responsible for motorcycle theft.
attributes.background: it is not easy to lock up a motorcycle on the street or your driveway however if there were more security features built into the bike, it could provide the additional protection required to do so.
attributes.additional_details:
Many bikes are only able to be locked through the wheels which can be removed relatively easily. If there was a way to secure the frame on more bikes it would make it a lot more difficult to steal. 
Manufacturers could also install trackers and alarms at the construction stage.
Motorcycles can help reduce congestion in cities and have lower emissions than most 4 wheeled vehicles.
The problem is too many people are being put off riding a motorcycle because of the risk of it being stolen.

attributes.action: Give HM Forces the right to buy their MOD housing under the right to buy scheme
attributes.background: Allow serving personnel to buy their MOD married quaters under the right to buy scheme based on the current scheme used for local authority housing, this would allow soldiers to settle in areas their wages do not allow, would also reduce maintenance costs to the MOD.

attributes.action: A Royal Commission to review ALL aspects of  health & social care in the UK
attributes.background: Demand has outstripped capacity. Review inc: healthy lifestyles, aging population, mental health, health & social care in the community. Duty of care to all healthcare  professions.Attracting,training,retention of new professions. Increased funding

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum due to misleading campaign lies in the first.
attributes.background: Lies made informed choices less likely. Unlike exaggeration & forecasts (where some variability may be inherent) lies have no factual basis. Among many, 2 prominent were: £350 million/wk paid to EU – to go to the NHS; & Turkey on the cusp of EU admission. Genuine & thorough campaign info was scarce.
attributes.additional_details: An independent body should regulate campaign information (as in commerce, where lies are justifiably banned). Democracy can't exist if voters can't judge the options, & as campaigns may be biased their protest to lies is inadequate. Additional reasons for a 2nd, honest referendum are: no mandate for Brexit's form; nearly half-in-half results; possible UK break-up; many years of negotiation likely; renegotiation of all current world trade deals; less EU trade access; & EU rules we have no say in.

attributes.action: Guarantee PIP for all people diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: If you are officially diagnosed with ASD/Autism by a GP or a health care professional such as a psychologist, psychiatrist or a multidisciplinary team, then a PIP assessment to prove your illness should not be needed. It should be recognised upon application when you provide written diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details: ASD/Autism is a life long condition and should automatically qualify for PIP. The assessment is nothing more than unnecessary bureaucracy that usually ends in refusal for PIP. I would also like to make the RT Hon Damian Green MP aware that the assessors that carry out these assessments do take advantage of an autistic person's disability to ensure they dont score any points in the assessment and refuse them PIP. If the RT Hon Damian Green would like more detail I am available to talk about it.

attributes.action: Ensure every school in the UK has Bullying awareness lessons for ages 5-16
attributes.background: Bullying effects many peoples lives, touches many family's & interrupts the personal and academic growth of every child. Personally as a child back in 1993 i was affected by bullying that still makes a impact on my adulthood today. I just don't see any improvement since then to protect our children
attributes.additional_details:
This petition suggests some of the following:

Every school is required by education policy through DfE to have group discussions setting out a plan on how to help pupils report bullying, its effects and challenges throughout academic growth.

Requests each school in UK to have Bullying awareness lessons ages 5-16 at least 3 times a year.

attributes.action: Carers Allowance Threshold To Stay In Line With 16 Hours Of Minimum Wage Work
attributes.background: Over 40,000 full time carers also work part time. The recent rise in minimum wage took 16 hour workers to £120 a week. the carers allowance threshold is £116 per week. Carers now face losing £62.70 themselves, plus a £30 carers premium paid to the cared for if they cant drop work hours
attributes.additional_details:
There is an option for carers to pay the money that takes them over in to a pension, but many carers need every penny, living week to week so they can ensure bills for them and the person they care for are paid. Carers should be able to work with out the stress of having to drop hours or give up work because the government fails to provide adequate support to a group of people that help save the NHS £130 billion.

https://www.carersuk.org

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cyclists to enter a trucks Blind spot.
attributes.background: A cyclist will always see a truck but the driver of a Heavy Good Vehicle will not always see a cyclist. Blame should therefore be on the cyclist for putting themselves into a dangerous area of a blind spot. Truck drivers know there is a blind spot but can't react to something they can't see.
attributes.additional_details: A HGV driver can't always see what's in their blind spot. But a cyclist will always see the HGV. Therefore it should be on  the cyclist to not put themselves in danger. The blame at the moment is always on the driver when he has limited vision but the cyclist does not have limited vision.

attributes.action: Free dental care for all full time students
attributes.background: Full time students over the age of 18 currently have to pay for dental care, which is very expensive and many struggle to afford. Students have to struggle to pay for university fees which is expensive enough e.g. Rent, food, college material and travel.

attributes.action: Suspend the 12 billion spent on overseas aid for cancer treatment and research.
attributes.background: One in two people are now affected by cancer. Since 2010 six of my relatives/ friends have died from cancer. Eight people I know currently have cancer, two with terminal cancer. A close relative is one of the two.
attributes.additional_details: The U.K. gives 12 billion pounds a year (0.7% GNI - source BBC - 2015) in overseas aid. I am not suggesting that this is stopped, only that as cancer is now so prevalent in our country ( one in two people are now affected - my husband's consultant quoted this) that temporarily this money is used to help the people in need in this country. Walk down the main corridor at The Christie (cancer specialist hospital) in Manchester at 9.00 am on any weekday to see how many people have this illness, and this is only one example of a hospital in the UK.

attributes.action: Establish a Financial Services Tribunal to resolve customer disputes.
attributes.background: Major banks and other financial services institutions are often in dispute with customers who deserve protection. Access to court is costly. The FOS ombudsman scheme is inadequate. The FCA is not equipped to resolve disputes. Tribunals offer scrutiny, justice and censure which deters misconduct.

attributes.action: Open premises to homeless people when the temperature falls.
attributes.background: change the law, to require anyone who is responsible for a community centre or a sports hall to open their premises to homeless people when the temperature falls below a certain level.
attributes.additional_details: Just read a news story about a guy freezing to death on the coldest night of the year. It reached -9'c here. Its a simply request, which would help in cold weather, not a quick fix, but a start!

attributes.action: Close hospitality establishments over the Christmas period.
attributes.background: Christmas is a family time, hospitality workers work extremely hard during the Christmas run up and many don't get Christmas day off, nevermind boxing day. Some things are needed over the festive period; eating out isn't one of them.
attributes.additional_details: As a chef, it is expected that I will work over the festive period, including Christmas day, boxing day and all bank holidays, with no extra incentive.   I fully support retail workers having Christmas day AND Boxing day off, but this should be extended to those who work in hospitality too. This is especially important for those who work away from their hometowns, as one day off is not long enough to get home to see their family and means a Christmas day spent alone.

attributes.action: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
attributes.background: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
There is an alarming lack of support for people fleeing domestic abuse, especially women/families. This manifests the deprivation that families often experience moving out from an abuser or from a shelter.

"The threat of poverty is often described as being ‘among the most formidable'" barriers (NOWLDEF, 2002:1) from leaving toxic - in some cases deadly - situations with serious consequences. This hole in the social safety net is short-sighted in both its financial and societal implications.

attributes.action: Prevent employers from banning religious/political symbols in the workplace
attributes.background: The ECJ has ruled that it is legal for employers to ban the wearing "any political, philosophical or religious sign" in the workplace. This is discriminatory, and will disproportionately affect religious minorities, particularly Muslim women. We call upon the government to reject the ECJ's ruling.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-39264845

attributes.action: Ask UK Gov to advise Queen to hold UK & Pakistani culture at the Palace in 2017.
attributes.background: An event was held at Buckingham Palace on 26/02/17 to celebrate Best of British and Indian culture. Similarly we ask the UK Government to advise Her Majesty to also hold an event to celebrate Pakistan and British culture.
attributes.additional_details: Both India and Pakistan are this year celebrating the 70th anniversary of independence. Pakistan and Britain have a much stronger historical bond than India, as Pakistan has always been an ally of UK. A unique fact is Her Majesty was once the Queen of Pakistan. There are 2million British Pakistani tax payers in UK. In the interest and fairness of justice, no one single country or community should be given preference over any other community.

attributes.action: Scrap plans to mark the Queens Sapphire Jubilee with a bank holiday.
attributes.background: An MP is calling for the Queens Sapphire Jubilee to marked with a bank holiday in June 2017. The MP will present his Queen's Sapphire Jubilee to the Commons shortly. This is yet another example of how we as a nation can apparently afford opulent royal events while having to endure austerity.

attributes.action: Reduce aid budget and fully fund an integrated health and social care service.
attributes.background: Our health and social care system is fragmented and in crisis.  The NHS is financially bankrupt and being kept afloat artificially.  The funding to UN Aid Budgets and other ill thought out financial aid initiatives should stop and that money diverted to the NHS and social care

attributes.action: Open an inquiry into Atos/Maximus and the work capability assessment
attributes.background: There should be an independent inquiry into the work capability assessments carried out by ATOS and MAXIMUS. We need to know more about the terms of the contracts to know whether they are selling our data. We need to know how many people have died because of their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The “health care professionals” employed by these companies, who work directly for the DWP, should listen to the consultants. They say that seriously ill people are fit for work, and some have died within the space of a year. These contracted companies are paid £1.6 billion. These are foreign companies who get rich off the British taxpayer. There is no concern for Disabled persons in the UK.
